children.subject:
<md>> Data 100 prereq met through stat 20?

Do you mean "**Data 8** prereq met through stat 20?" Since that's the prereq you seem to be asking about. Might be better to ask on Data 001. Luckily someone already did and this was the response yesterday:
> Stat 20 will remain a viable alternative to Data C8 as a prerequisite for Data C100 moving forward. However, Stat 20 is not approved to substitute for Data 8 toward the major requirements if taken after Spring 2022. If you wish to declare the Data Science major (or minor) and have not already taken Stat 20, you should plan to take Data C8. If you do not plan to declare the Data Science major or minor but simply want to enroll in Data C100, Stat 20 is fine.
> - by Laura Imai and Aaron Giacosa

So you should be fine to enroll for any semester.

Not answering in student's answer though as idk about EECS technical requirements (though maybe @10288 will help, in any case data 100 is a great class with an awesome course staff. I would suggest taking it even if it doesn't satisfy degree reqs -- though i also understand not everyone has the liberty to take courses if they don't satisfy degree reqs due to lack of time).</md>

history.content:
Rahul has already answered your question regarding stat 20 being used in place of data 8 for the data 100 prereq.

The answer to your second question is yes

children.subject: Ishaan was on Data 100 staff so he would know better than me (so was Suraj who I linked in the above followup but given that I'm L&S and not EECS, I was not sure if what Suraj said was relevant to your question as idk how EECS reqs works). If you are still unsure then I would recommend emailing your ESS advisor and reporting back here so that people know for the future! That sounds like the most helpful thing to do IMO. But Ill leave unresolved for if an EECS peer (knowledgable about eecs technical reqs) could help out better
Update: It counts for EECS for 20 unit upperdiv (and also towards 40 units engineering req).

Is it correct that Data 100 counts as an EECS upper div technical? For L&S I know that it counts but couldn't find it as an acceptable course under EECS. Any clarification is helpful. Thank you in advance.

history.content:
I am taking Stat 20 for Spring 2022 sem. I have already taken 61A and 16A. Am I allowed to take Data 100 for the Summer 2022? 

Also, does Data 100 count as an upperdiv EECS technical (counting towards the 20 upperdiv units)? I am an EECS sophomore. 

Thank you!
